info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 8:45PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...DENSE SEA FOG IMPACTING COASTAL COMMUNITIES... Webcams and surface observations continue show dense sea fog impacting coastal communities of Southeast South Carolina from roughly Hilton Head north to McClellanville. This includes coastal communities such as Edisto Beach, Fripp Island, Hunting Island, Kiawah Island, Johns Island, James Island, Folly Beach, Downtown Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Sullivans Island, Isle of Palms and McClellanville. The sea fog will meander inland to near the Highway 17 corridor through midnight. Some improvement is expected early Wednesday morning as winds increase ahead of a cold front. Visibilities in the sea fog will drop to 1/4 mile or less, possibly near zero at times near bodies of water. Motorists driving along the coast should be alert for rapidly changing visibilities.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down and leave extra distance ahead of you in case a sudden stop is needed.
